course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Issues in Social Biology: from Diet to Diseases, DNA to Deforestation
course.class_descr: Issue In Soc BIO: Diet To Dise

notes.note: Instructor permission required to pre-enroll in the Wednesday sections. Priority given to athletes for Wednesday sections. For permission to enroll in a Wednesday evening section, athletes should have their coach e-mail pjd2@cornell.edu with the sport, the athlete's name and athlete's net ID.

Prerequisite: one year introductory biology and/or BIOPL 2410. Co-register: BIOPL 2421, for plant science undergraduates (and highly recommended for other science majors). Recommended prerequisite: one year introductory chemistry. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 3420 except by written permission of instructor.
Co-register: BIOPL 2420. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 3440.
Co-register: BIOPL 2420. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 3440.
Co-register: BIOPL 2420. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 3440.

Prerequisite: one year introductory biology. Co-register: BIOPL 3440 or written permission of instructor. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 2420 unless written permission obtained from instructor.
Co-register: BIOPL 3420. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 2440.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Molecular Biology and Genetic Engineering of Plants

notes.note: Prerequisite: two majors-level biology courses or course in plant systematics or permission of instructor.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Strategies and Methods in Drug Discovery

notes.note: Prerequisite: one year introductory biology and organic chemistry course or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course or permission of instructor.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Plant Evolution and the Fossil Record

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOPL 2410 or equivalent, or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: BIOPL 2420 or 3420, or equivalent and BIOBM 3300 or 3310, or equivalent, or permission of instructor.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Molecular Plant-Pathogen Interactions II: Molecular Plant-Microbe Interactions

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 2810, BIOMG 3300 or 3310, and BIOPL 4831.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Plant Molecular Biology II: Plant Biotechnology

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOPL 4831 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: previous enrollment in course to be taught or equivalent. Students must register using individual study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Mineral Nutrition: From Plants to Humans

notes.note: Enrollment preference given to: graduate students and advanced undergraduates in systematic biology.
Prerequisite: BIOPL 4480 or equivalent background in evolution, or written permission of instructor.
Requirement for graduate students doing work in plant biology.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Problems in Plant Cell and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Enrollment limited to: first- and second-year graduate students in Plant Cell and Molecular Biology Program.
Enrollment preference given to: graduate students with priority given to majors or minors in plant molecular biology. Prerequisite for undergraduates: written permission of instructor.
Enrollment limited to and required for: second-, third-, and fourth-year graduate students in Plant Cell and Molecular Biology.
